description.narrative: Capacity Building Project Between the Government of the People’s Republic of China and United Nations Development Programme To Enable China to Prepare Its Third National Communication to the UNFCCC

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. No. of CCM and CCA measures formulated under the 3NC process and included in the completed 3NC Report that are planned for implementation by end-of-project (EOP). 2. No. of GOC agencies/institutions that are actively involved in the inventory and analysis of sectorial GHG emissions by EOP 3. No. of center and local governments that integrate CCM and CCA concerns in their development planning by EOP. 4. No. of national and local government agencies, and private sector entities that were involved in the 3NC process (inclusive of BURs) by EOP. 5. No. of comprehensive researches/studies conducted and completed for use in the compilation of GHG emissions inventory of industrial processes by EOP. 6. No. of users of the China Climate Change Info-Net each year starting 2015. 7. No. of Climate Change mitigation policies and measures developed by local experts by EOP. 8. No of trained nationals on NC formulation that were involved in the 3NC process by EOP.

Output 1: 1.1 By December, 2018, 1GHG inventory in 2010, 2012 and 2014 from the energy sector including fossil fuel combustion, biomass combustion, CH4 emission from coal mining and post-mining activates, non-energy uses of fossil fuel, international bunkers has been completed. The recalculation of the inventory of 2005 from energy activity also has been completed.
1.2 40 researches/studies have been conducted and completed during the preparation of GHG emissions inventory from energy sector. Rest researches are being conducted and prepared as planned.
1.3 By December, 2019,. GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 from Mineral production processing, industrial chemical processes, industrial metal production process, production of halocarbons and sulfur hexafluoride, consumption of halocarbons and sulfur hexafluoride has been completed. Recalculation of GHG inventory in 2005 on 9 emission sources has also been completed.
1.4 50 comprehensive researches/studies has been completed for used in the compilation of GHG emission inventory of industrial processes. 1.5 GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 from agriculture including CH4 emissions from paddy fields, N2O emissions from croplands, CH4 emission from animal enteric fermentation, CH4 and N2O emissions from manure management systems have been completed.
1.6 18 comprehensive researches/studies for use in the compilation of inventory have been completed. Rest researches are being conducted as planned.
1.7 GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 from LULUCF sector including forest lands, other woodlands and forest lands converted to non-forest lands has been completed. 1.8 24 researches and studies are being conducted as planned, which include: activity data collection, calculation and spatialization; emission factors collection, monitoring, update and revising; and model calibration.
1.9 GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 from waste sector including CH4 emissions from waste landfills, waste incineration, CH4 and N2O emission from biological treatment of solid waste, CH4 emissions from domestic and commercial wastewater treatment, CH4 emissions from industrial wastewater treatment, and N2O emissions from wastewater treatment have been completed. GHG inventory in 2005 has been recalculated.
1.10No. of comprehensive researches/studies conducted and completed for use in the compilation of GHG emissions inventory of the waste sector by EOP(37):37
1.11 No. of updated sectoral data sets uploaded to the National GHG Emissions Database by EOP(4): 4
1.12 No. of formulated sets of CCM and CCA policies uploaded in the National GHG Emissions Database by EOP(4): 4. 1.13 No. of formulated sets of CCM and CCA action plans uploaded to the National GHG Emissions Database by EOP(4): 4.
1.14 No. of completed studies based on the GHG inventories on the characteristics and future trends of climate change in China by EOP(1): 1 1.15No. of comprehensive researches/studies conducted and completed for use in the identification and evaluation of potential CC mitigation actions by EOP(4): 5 1.16No. of operational improved/modified simulation models for forecasting GHG emissions and emission trends using the updated GHG inventory data by EOP(2): 5 1.17No. of scenario analyses developed using the improved/modified simulation models, and utilized in CCM and CCA policy making and action planning by EOP(6) :6
Output 2: No. of national and local climate change adaptation programs developed and implemented by the national and local governments as influenced by the 3NC process by EOP(2) : 2 Output 3: No. of national and local climate change mitigation programs developed and implemented by the national and local governments as influenced by the 3NC process by EOP(3): 3
Output 4: 4.1 Around 323,684 visitors have browsed the China Climate Change Info-Net since 2015. China Climate Change Info-Net totally issued information 13,053items, of which 7,744 items in Chinese and 5,309 items in English.
4.2 No. of national and local climate change programs developed and implemented by the national and local governments as influenced by the advocacy and public awareness campaigns that were carried out under the 3NC process by EOP(3) : 1
Output 5: 5.1 GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 of the Hong Kong SAR have been completed. 5.2 5 5.3 GHG inventories in 2010, 2012 and 2014 of the Macau SAR have been completed.
5.4 No. of CCM and CCA policies formulated by the MAC SAR based on the GHG inventories and included in the completed 3NC Report by EOP(5): 5
Output 6: 6.1. 62 researches and studies (GHG inventory 2012 and 2014 for 31 provinces) has been conducted in the context of the 3NC carried out by local experts by 2017.
6.2 More than 101 local experts have been involved in preparing and analyzing the provincial GHG inventories.
6.3 94 climate change mitigation policies and measures have been developed by local experts by 2017.
6.4 1 climate change adaptation policy and measure has been developed.
6.5 1 research on systematic observation of climate has been conducted by local experts.
6.6 1 projects contributed inputs on climate change technology transfer & cooperation.
6.7 190 trained nationals on NC formulation were involved in 3NC process.
6.8 190 trained nationals on NC formulation were employed for NC-related activities on a regular basis.
6.9 No. of integrated CCM and CCA measures and action plans developed formulated by the national government and local governments by EOP(110): 94
6.10 No. of local governments that have initiated GHG inventories and other NC process activities at the local level by EOP(33): 33
6.11 No. of national and local government agencies that made use of the 3NC for their development planning activities with climate change mainstreamed in it by EOP(10):20
Output 7: 7.1 The 1st BUR has been submitted to UNFCCC. 2nd BUR has been completed.
7.2 1 adjustments has been made on the CCM and CCA measure based on the findings and recommendations of 1st BUR..
7.3 8 government departments or ministries including NDRC, MOA, State Forestry Administration , MEP, Ministry of Transport, National Energy Administration、Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, are making use of MRV process developed as part of the BUR.
